website_summaries.verdict: Black-and-chrome wrist roller for hand, wrist, and forearm strengthening, very reasonably priced.
pros: Padded foam handle offers comfort grip and minimizes hand fatigue
bar doesn't slip, even when using heavy weights
Works with all standard weight plates
Great training tool for improved performance in a variety of sports, or as a rehabilitation tool
cons: Grips appear to come loose with use, and may need to be reinforced with tape or glue at home

customer_reviews.title: Solution to sliding foam handles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product knowing that the foam pads were going to come off and honestly I don't like any kind of foam handles mainly because I don't have a good grip with them. So as soon as I got the product I took the handles off and put some grip tape from a baseball bat on it and now it wonderful to use.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely outstanding.  One of the best forearm exercises around.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hammers my forearms. I used to do 30 lb wrist curls and thought that made me tough. Hah! Not! This was humbling - even 10-15 lb weights were hard to do. My forearms burned and my muscles were pumped after just 1 set. The results are visible in less than 3 weeks of work - more definition, a touch more size and way more veins popping out. Individual muscles in my forearm now routinely show. Most importantly, the twisting action is very practical - comes in handy on a day to day basis. Under arm twisting is absolutely brutal and has built up significant strength. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absoluetly hate working the forearm( it hurts)
customer_reviews.text: Please read the review that talks about using rubbing alcohol bike grips to replace the foam. If you do so you will be much happier with this product. The foam is not so great but if you cut it off, apply the alcohol and new bike grips it works great. FYI the alcohol will dry quick so pour some in the grip and cover the hole so it does not leak out, also have a towel handy so you can get a good grip when you try to push the bike handles on. FYI: If you have any cuts on your the alcohol does wonders for helping you find then, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I went with this one and am mostly satisfied, after a few months the padded handles have ...
customer_reviews.text: My wrists and forearms have never felt so blasted. But seriously, as someone who doesn't buy into "gimmicky" items, this simple piece of equipment is by far the most effective way of building wrist and forearm strength and mass. The quality of this particular item is somewhat uninspired and it's more difficult than expected to find a decent version of it. I went with this one and am mostly satisfied, after a few months the padded handles have started to spin freely unless gripped extremely tightly. Though, the rope and weight spindle are still fine.
customer_reviews.author: doppz

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Blasts Your Forearms. Works with Olympic Plates.
customer_reviews.text: Not expensive and works what it's supposed to. Was worried whether or not it would work with Olympic plates, but rest assured, it works. Only concern is the same as other reviewers, and that is the foam hand grips. Not sure about the durability/longevity of them, but they are fine for now. If/when they go out, I'll most likely go with the rubber grip route. Other than that, this is a great piece of workout equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad R.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: It's actually a fairly simple concept and not at all original. I haven't had it long enough to know, but it does seem to get the expected results and looks like it will last. I'm 70 years old and I am using it about three times a day to restore strength in my hand where I had surgery and for general strengthening of both forearms. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Marine

customer_reviews.title: This thing is perfect for working out for your forearms and grip
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for working out for your forearms and grip. You have to make sure to periodically tighten the bolt that is holding the weight on the rope though because it does slowly unscrew itself when you are using it. But it usually take about 2 weeks of using it everyday to really notice it coming loose. I haven't put really heavy weight so i cannot tell you whats the maximum weight on this but I've just been using a 5lbs plate and that is WAY more than enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: SpartanGabez

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Product broke within two months of use. Three times a week, for three sets with a 10lb. weight.
customer_reviews.author: Man of La Book

customer_reviews.title: The only problem I have is that the grips won't ...
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have is that the grips won't stay on the handles. One side had been an issue for a while, which throws the whole workout out of flow. Then it completely came loose, slid off, and down went the weight. It very narrowly missed breaking my foot.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: I gave it two stars because I liked it.. while it lasted. Which was about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it two stars because I liked it.. while it lasted. Which was about 2 weeks. The good: Comfortable grip, holds the weight nicely and very easy to disassemble and assemble to add weight. The bad: One side started becoming loose early on until it completely came off. The handles aren't welded onto the center piece so once it comes loose it will break and unless you like putting it back on after every half set, I recommend you buy a better one. You get what you pay for in this case. I recommend buying one of higher quality of you want it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas M.

customer_reviews.title: Without these I'll have to furnish my own makeshift replacement that will not fit like the pieces actually designed for the task
customer_reviews.text: When I received this item it was missing 2 pieces. The screw-on end cap and the washer that holds the weights on the end pin. Both of which are clear as day in the product picture. Without these I'll have to furnish my own makeshift replacement that will not fit like the pieces actually designed for the task. Cost of shipping isnt worth the return making this a metal bar with rubber until i fix it myself. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little device for getting that quick forearm pump haha. Works well overall and the metal is super solid. As others have noted, the foam handles are not the nicest but there are plenty of workarounds for this that others have mentioned. Honestly just pulling off the foam and wrapping in duct tape would work fine haha.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing!! Great shoulder work when having arms straight out, but stand on a bench and keep hands at waist level if wanna work the forearms only. I use the loading pin for my neck harness as well. A plus for having one and not just a rope that goes through the whole of a weight plate. I recommend, 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Big Deak

customer_reviews.title: It's a well made wrist roller. 'Nough said.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a wrist roller, this is it. Easy to add either standard or Olympic weights. I haven't maxed out the weight yet, so if you are looking for over 60 lbs of wrist rolling, maybe you need something else, but it works perfectly in the 30 lb range
customer_reviews.author: Eric R

customer_reviews.title: Missing part!
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fair. However, it is missing the anchor at the end to hold the weight. This seems to be a common problem with this product/seller. You can clearly see though the package that the part is missing yet they send it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Thomas Koester

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best forearm workout tool you can get for the price. The foam grip is nice. The weight holder is solid. Rope types are always more awkward than the wide flat bands (can have uneven weight distribution side-to-side), but the band types are always a lot more expensive. This one does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: TheW83

customer_reviews.title: Build stronger forearms.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for to aid developing my forearms. This piece of equipment is not available at my gym so I was using dumbbells to do wrist curls. My form was neither satisfactory nor providing the improvement in strength I was seeking. Forearm strength is required when biking using aerobars.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Austin Law

customer_reviews.title: Old gym had one, new gym didn't
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for finishing off my back and bi's day, no real substitute for the forearm pump you get from the low weight and simple exercise this tool helps you accomplish. Haven't had any real issues with the materials after 2 months of once-a-week use. If the foam handles wear I think I'll replace them with electrical or medical tape and be set as the metal handles underneath are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: KC Fussell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a little over a month and I gotta say it's worth the money. The screw does come loose but no big deal, it won't fall on your feet unless you never check it. Only bad thing I can say about it is that mine didn't come with a weight limit on it but I have 20lbs on it and no problems
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Martinez

customer_reviews.title: 6 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea and it fits my needs, but the hand grips make the product ok . I give the product 6 out of 10 ( work on those hand grips)
customer_reviews.author: Brian buck

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this thing at all and not for the usual reasons one would dislike a piece of forearm exercise equipment. The foam grips immediately started sliding the first time i used it making it impossible to complete a single rep and then one of the grips was torn by the end of the first workout. I eventualy got this thing usuable with some electrical tape and some old t-shirt material but for the effort it would have been just as easy (and cheaper) to make my own out of a wooden rod and some rope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use and definitely makes a difference!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves adding this to his arm workouts. It’s easy to add and remove weights and it’s sturdy. Definitely gives him a good burn in his forearms!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: **DANGER!!! DO NOT BUY!**
customer_reviews.text: Item snapped and weight landed on my toe causing some serious damage. DO NOT BUY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material. I've been putting 10 pounds and will easily be increasing with no problem. The only con is at some point the grips need to be replaced due to spinning. but I've read about users replacing the grips with baseball bat tape. Seems legit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but I can see the grips not lasting.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Feels good in the hands, although I can see the foamy grips not lasting forever. But you can always tape them up as some people in the reviews seem to have done.
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer Occhipinti

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing definitely works and I don't really see how it could be any better for the price. The grips are great, no concerns whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jones102

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.  The cord is a little long though.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product - well built. I'm 5'8 and the cord is a little long. But not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Salsa Dude

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very sturdy. It would have got a 5 star, but once you add over 25 lbs, the grips will begin slipping. I will have to buy some bike grips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy way to fully exhaust your forearms
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tough, it makes my forearms super tired in a very efficient fast workout
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and functional old school forearm training. Getting ready ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and functional old school forearm training. Getting ready for DH mountain bike season. Might have to replace the foam grips in the future but other wise looks as if it will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Works until it snaps
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 7 months until part of the clinch which attached to the vertical rod for the weights snapped off mid set! Weights toppled to the ground from height
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Shankar

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for working arms and so easy to use while standing watching tv.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Searcy

customer_reviews.title: Forearm size
customer_reviews.text: The best exercise for your forearm. Folds up nicely to transport to and from the gym, or work. Not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Weeks

customer_reviews.title: OK, but needs a little repair
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but the foam grip on one side has come loose and needs to be repaired. There is a lot of torque on the grip so it needs to be very securely fastened to the aluminum rod.
customer_reviews.author: David Bailey

customer_reviews.title: It really works my forearms
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike is that the line is too long and I'm 6'4
customer_reviews.author: Omezikam Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Blasts like a blaster
customer_reviews.text: I have blasted my forearms sufficiently with this blaster. Foam handle sleeves will tear but with your stronger forearms gripping bare metal is no problem. Rope is sturdy, weight holder is sturdy and conveniently detaches from rope for easy loading.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good product so far
customer_reviews.text: Good product so far. No issues yet with grips falling apart. Forearms are burning up after using this product. Nice job.
customer_reviews.author: JLK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good. I've used for forearm workouts and it's awesome. Haven't used any weights above 10 lbs plates but it seems sturdy enough. The handles, wire, "plate-holder", all seem to be pretty well-built. Have had no issues whatsoever. Another guy at the gym has had the same product for a lot longer than I've had mine and told me that he has had no issues with his purchase either. And I see him use his all the time. Not sure what's been going on with other reviewers who claim pieces were missing when they ordered the product. The only reason I give it four stars is because I haven't tested it with heavier plates.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this forearm blaster, it's not complex, simple like it should be.
customer_reviews.author: felicia

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is intended to do. Easy to use, easy to add weight. The grips do become loose over time but its a simple fix with a bit of grip tape.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: Very good, just put the weights on and swing it across something and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: sdanzzz

customer_reviews.title: Visible results in no time
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality forearm blaster and the large drum allows half the weight to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C in Utah

customer_reviews.title: Arrived intact; seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find one of these at any of the fitness stores in the city but was dissuaded from ordering this by the several reviews about the missing screw cap. Eventually, I got tired of looking for it and figured it was worth the risk ordering it online. Mine arrived with all the pieces and it seems pretty sturdy. I've used it a couple of times without any problems; hits the forearms hard which is exactly why I wanted it. If I have any problems I'll update my review and rating accordingly. Otherwise, definitely worth the 15-20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos B

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist strengthener.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool for wrist strengthening. You need a standard barbell plate (or something similar). I got a 10-pound weight, and that's a lot to start out with. Should have gone for 5! Hah!!
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: As far as providing a workout for your forearms this ...
customer_reviews.text: As far as providing a workout for your forearms this product does its job well. The grips however do not last very long and after a few weeks one of the grips became loose and spins freely unless you overly exert your grip. It is still usable but it does cause a minor annoyance when having to overgrip the handles to prevent them from slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the same type of idea wrist and forearm blaster from sports authority and it was amazing, but lost it sadly. When I went to go get another one they didn't sell them anymore. So I bought this one. The black foam was not properly glued on to the bar so it came off on the first use so it makes it really hard to use. I mean the general idea is there but I'm going to have to go to home depot and by some electrical tape and rig it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and I use it almost everyday. Very sturdy and I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy M.

customer_reviews.title: Gives a good burn on the forearms
customer_reviews.text: Been using it constantly sine buying it, haven't had the foam slip on me. Although I use them with weightlifting gloves don't know if that has anything to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: So happy I bought this item, works excellent. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This wrist blaster is decent for the price. My one gripe is that the line seems a bit flimsy. I put a 10lb weight on it and it seems to strain at that level and I don't think it can handle much more. There is a grommet that holds the line in and it came out a few times. The first time, I didn't realize and felt fortunate that the line didn't pull through the hole because it would have been a task to get the line back in. Otherwise, this is a great tool to work out the wrists and forearms.
customer_reviews.author: CT Bruin

customer_reviews.title: Looking Forward to Ridding Self of Stick Arms!
customer_reviews.text: Unaccustomed to forearm workouts, I bought this after researching the best forms of exercise for forearms and this was the best available option. After just two up-and-downs with a relatively light weight (10lbs, for now), my forearms were burning! I push through a few more times and I do it during commercials while watching tv. Fairly simple, lol.
customer_reviews.author: HurleyJ

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with the metal rod or plate to hold the weights on! In short not all pieces in package. The padding on it is terrible on the hands for those who don’t use gloves. Drill a hole in pvc and tie a rope up it will work better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality. Much better than I had even expected. A+
customer_reviews.author: Nick DeSantis

customer_reviews.title: Grips Slip
customer_reviews.text: Grips began to slip after 3 use. Had to but duct tap on to keep them from slipping off while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A.

customer_reviews.title: so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: i hear a lot of complaints of the rope tearing or the chain link breaking but i havent run into anything in the short period of time i had it. but it does the job nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Chillo

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to build those forearms
customer_reviews.text: Just what I need to blast my forearms in the gym!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Robles

customer_reviews.title: good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product. I don't know what people are complaining about. it doesn't slip as they suggested. maybe they have improved the product since the last complaints? My only negative comment would be that when you are lowering it the friction sometimes can burn quicker than would be expected. Its a strong, well made product. And come on, its under 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: JohnG67

customer_reviews.title: The thumb wraps uneven.
customer_reviews.text: I like how sturdy the product is, but one of the thumb wraps is way bigger than the other. Pretty much wraps around my palm area of the thumb while the other just wraps around my thumb. I don't think it should be like that. Especially on my dominant hand.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Only for light weights
customer_reviews.text: Be careful... this is not for serious use. With only 70 lbs on it, the loop on the clip snapped and almost took out my feet. Use this for only light weights....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercising those often neglected wrists and forearms!
customer_reviews.text: This little gizmo does will give your forearms a run for the money. You'll know they had a workout!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndamar

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far it works great and works well for what it was designed to do
customer_reviews.author: Hannah H

customer_reviews.title: This Does the Trick
customer_reviews.text: Sure you could tie a rope toa stick and wind up a weight but this is much cooler. Works as designed. Looks nice. Would like to have an insert for the threaded rod to keep the weight from feeling sloppy as you wind it up and down. Will fit mine with something tight and drill out the hole for the rod to give it a more solid feel.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel777

customer_reviews.title: Especially good for older persons, and if you are homebound
customer_reviews.text: A really good way to maintain forearm strength without incurring a repetitive motion injury. The length of the weight cord is very long so you could stand on a step.
customer_reviews.author: Xx

customer_reviews.title: This is a very simple and effective wrist and forearm ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple and effective wrist and forearm exercise tool. I removed the bar at the end and attach the cable to my Bowflex instead. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Since 1998

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction. Well made. Nothing cheap about it. These are a fantastic tool for developing your forearm muscles and improving grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: A must for forearm workout
customer_reviews.text: This really blasted my forearms and I got swole the first time I used it. For better grip, use gloves or wrap the bars with grip tape.
customer_reviews.author: Mig

customer_reviews.title: Wish the string was a band as if you put ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the string was a band as if you put alot off weight on it doesn't distribute the weight evenly vs a strap design
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: really disappointed, broken product
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed, arrived with the packaging open, the equipment broken and parts are missing.
customer_reviews.author: Hill

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: Less than a week of using it the pieces fall apart, once even with no weight on it. Infact I haven't put more than 5 pounds of weight on it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Krynor

customer_reviews.title: Works great, until it falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The bolt on the bottom that is meant to keep the plates in place broke after a month of use. Otherwise, it is an excellent tool for developing both forearm strength and size.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I took the foam pads off because they would spin ...
customer_reviews.text: I took the foam pads off because they would spin in my hand and replaced them with tape, as for the bottom piece it could have came with a lock nut and washer so it wont come loose as often.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after reading the negative reviews because I thought, "What are the chances it will be shipped with missing pieces to ME". Well, it was shipped incomplete to ME. Now I have to go to the store and buy a washer and a nut that fits. Dumb people like this is what gives small businesses a bad name. Gave 2 stars because once i purchase those items, i'm sure it will work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Really well made and a great forearm workout
customer_reviews.text: Really well made and a great forearm workout. Seems like it could hold a fair amount of weight with no fear of breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Merk

customer_reviews.title: Useless...
customer_reviews.text: Product was shipped to my house missing pieces. Probably a warehouse error.
customer_reviews.author: Marple

customer_reviews.title: Foam covered handles fall apart
customer_reviews.text: The metal structure of the product is sound. However, the foam covering the handles falls apart easily. Not a big deal. Replacement foam and/or tape is an easy fix. Otherwise, I enjoy using it and like the results. It is a nice addition to your home gym. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LBOH

customer_reviews.title: Great for developing forearm strength
customer_reviews.text: I used this at least 3 days a week. I would use it more if I had time. It's a great way to strengthen grip. I bought it with the idea of building up my forearm strength for my baseball swing. It has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Reacher

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed. The foam on the handles is starting ...
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. The foam on the handles is starting to separate, nothing some grip tape won't fix. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Peek

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The handle material sucks on bare hands but it does what it's meant.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but needs updating
customer_reviews.text: Handles are squishy, and makes it touch to get a good grip, a solid firm grip would improve it. Wrapping with tape was my quick fix.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This gives you an insane burn and pump after just minutes of using!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love the burn whenever I use this. I’ve noticed my arms don’t o shake anymore whenever I’m benching
customer_reviews.author: Ivan M

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to work the forearms in a way that gripping a bar just doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This works great for me. I use it for forearms, holding my arms straight out and rolling it up and down with a small plate weight attached. Easy to use. I have had this for 3 years now and it is still holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great my kids love using it easy to add/take off weighs
customer_reviews.author: Brad C.

customer_reviews.title: simple, useful
customer_reviews.text: You've seen them at the gym, and now you can have it at home. Pretty hard to mess this up, and it's just what it looks like. You could make this yourself from home depot, or you can be lazy like me and just buy it. I'm happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: MattL

customer_reviews.title: It works great, unfortunately the grips on the handle is loose
customer_reviews.text: It works great, unfortunately the grips on the handle is loose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great piece for working out the lower part of your ...
customer_reviews.text: Great piece for working out the lower part of your arms. You need to work on rolling it up so all the weight isnt on one side. Once you get that down you'll get a great burn.
customer_reviews.author: KBS

customer_reviews.title: Love this item
customer_reviews.text: Love this item, does great work with 10-20 lbs reps in between my sets of compound lifts. Construction on this piece isn't amazing, the foam handles tend to slip sometimes, but overall it is worth the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap foam padding
customer_reviews.text: The foam padding ripped entirely with less than a week of normal use. very cheap quality foam to say the least. Would not recommend unless they fix the foaming
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: End piece
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with out a end piece so now there’s no way to secure the weight one there. It’s useless without that piece.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua schultz

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Had it for a year or so
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Works great. Had it for a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but effective
customer_reviews.text: Used to have one of these in my gym. loved it so I bought my own. You can tell that this thing is not the highest quality. The rubber handles have a bit of slippage but otherwise works well. I have seen much better quality however, the price is right for what you get with this. I would reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: The price of this product is great; or would be, if the product worked. It arrived missing the same product as the other negative reviews: the plate that holds the weight at the end of the rope, and the corresponding nut to hold this place in place, so I can't even use it. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. The handle started spinning day 1 and so ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. The handle started spinning day 1 and so trying to finish a set you just spin in place. The metal edges are sharp and will cut you if you try to get ahold of the middle to prevent the sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent way to strengthen your forearms and shoulders for golf
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent way to strengthen your forearms and shoulders for golf. Hand spring exercisers are better for grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: Music Is Life

customer_reviews.title: What else do you sell?
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I had a old fashion roller with a rope. This is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Nieliwocki

customer_reviews.title: Works well but wrist curling twenty five pound on rope ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but wrist curling twenty five pound on rope puts a lot of stress on rubber grip handles...well my rubber grip became unglued from bar...
customer_reviews.author: Tim kirby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to use. The handles seem to be holding up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Coomes

customer_reviews.title: Great for strengthening wrist after fracture has healed.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to attach the additional weights. Otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: amra serdarevic

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is...
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great wrist trainer that is a must for your home training routine. You just need to get weight for it, but any kind of exercise will work if done regularly.
customer_reviews.author: V3

product_meta.title: GoFit Wrist and Forearm Blaster - Muscle Strength
feature_bullets: STRENGTHEN: Create power and strength in your hands, wrists, and forearms with the GoFit Wrist and Forearm Blaster!
HANDLES: The GoFit Wrist and Forearm Blaster features foam grip handles for comfortable and convenient exercise.
WEIGHT: The GoFit Wrist and Forearm Blaster is compatible with standard size weight plates, allowing you to be in control of the resistance!
GREAT FOR: The Wrist and Forearm Blaster is a great training tool for sports that require wrist and forearm strength, such as golf, baseball, tennis, wrestling, football, climbing, and more!
USE: The Wrist and Forearm Blaster is extremely simple to use and is a time proven method for developing superior grip strength.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
